resources.string: This information will help us provide the most relevant data

Keeping yourself entertained and educated is just a quiz away. Want to have some fun or learn about a topic? Curated to learn while having fun, our online quizzes are an excellent source of knowledge and entertainment. Take a quiz today to discover amazing facts about yourself or the world.
What is the difference between val and var in Kotlin?
A. Variables declared with var are final those with val are not
B. Variables declared with val can only access const members
C. Variables declared with val are final,those with val are not
D. var is scoped to the nearest function block and val is scoped to the nearest enclosing block
Does Kotlin have primitive data types, such as int, long, float?
A. Yes, Kotlin is similar to Java in this respect
B. No, Kotlin does not have nor use primitive data types
C. Yes, but Kotlin internally always converts them to their non-primitive counterparts
D. No, not at language level. But the Kotlin compiler makes use of JVM primitives for best performance
